recordings.canundel: You can reverse this by using Undelete.
recordings.delete_details: This will delete the Recording Rule
recordings.heading: Recordings
recordings.subtitle: Subtitle
recordings.title: Title

sched.endoffset_label: Number of Extra Minutes to Record at End
sched.heading: Schedule recording
sched.inetref_desc: Use TheTVDB, TVmaze or TMDB to look up recording metadata. Select a radio button above and use the link to search the web site. Once you find the correct series on the web page, select it and copy the numeric id from the URL, or from the web page in the case of thetvdb.com. Enter that in the input box immediately after the prefix xxxx.py_
sched.maxeps_label: Maximum Number of Episodes to Keep
sched.maxnewest_desc: If unchecked, stop recording when maximum episodes are reached.
sched.startoffset_label: Number of Extra Minutes to Record at Start

type.del_override: Record this showing with normal options
type.rec_override: Record this showing with override options

status.backends_detail: Backend: {{ Name }} is a {{ Type }} on IP {{ IP }}
status.card_text: Card: {{ CardId }}, Input: {{ Id }} is {{ InputName }}, Display Name: {{ DisplayName }}
status.encoder_text: Encoder {{ Id }} is on host {{ HostName }}, State: {{ State }}
status.endtime_text: This recording is scheduled to end at {{ EndTime }}.
status.frontends_detail: Frontend: {{ Name }}, IP-Port: {{ IP }}:{{ Port }}, Online: {{ OnLine }}
status.jobs_text: Jobs currently in Queue or recently ended
status.schedule_text: The next {{ length }} show(s) that are scheduled for recording.

backendctrl.start_desc: The command used to start the backend when running on the master backend server (e.g. sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend start).
backendctrl.stop_desc: The command used to stop the backend when running on the master backend server (e.g. sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend stop)
backendctrl.subtitle: Commands to Start and Stop the Master Backend
backendctrl.title: Backend Control

master.attempts_desc: Number of times the frontend will try to wake up the master backend.
master.cmd_desc: The command used to wake up your master backend server (e.g. wakeonlan 00:00:00:00:00:00).
master.delay_desc: Length of time the frontend waits between tries to wake up the master backend. This should be the time your master backend needs to startup. Set to 0 to disable.
master.title: Master Backend

slave.sleep_desc: The command used to put this slave to sleep. If set, the master backend will use this command to put this slave to sleep when it is not needed for recording.
slave.title: Slave Backends
slave.wake_desc: The command used to wake up this slave from sleep. This setting is not used on the master backend.

backendwake.subtitle: These control wakeup of the master backend by the frontend and wakeup of slave backends by the master backend
backendwake.title: Backend Wakeup Settings

ceton.deviceid_desc: Device ID of the Ceton tuner (Read only, derived from IP address and tuner)
ceton.ipaddress_desc: IP Address of the Ceton device (192.168.200.1 by default)
ceton.title: Ceton Cablecard Tuner
ceton.tuner_desc: Number of the tuner on the Ceton device (first tuner is number 0)

capture.delete_all_all: Delete All capture Cards on all hosts

demo.file_desc: A local MPEG file used to simulate a recording.
demo.title: Demo Test Recorder

capture.device_desc: When you change this setting, the text below should change to the name and type of your card. If the card cannot be opened, an error message will be displayed.
capture.deviceid_desc: Device ID of the Sat>IP tuner.

diseqc.address_desc: The DiSEqC address of the switch in Hexadecimal notation (0xnn). If 0x is not in front of the string it will be assumed to be in decimal notation and will be converted.
diseqc.cmdrepeat_desc:
Number of repeat (command with repeat flag ON) or resend (the same command) DiSEqC commands.
If value is higher than 10, command will be resend N-10 times.
If value is lower than 10, command will be repeated N times.
Repeat useful for unreliable DiSEqC equipment; resend useful when unreliable DiSEqC equipment has broken/unsupported repeat flag support.
diseqc.description_desc: Optional descriptive name for this device, to make it easier to configure settings later.

lnb.lofhigh_desc: This defines the offset the frequency coming from the LNB will be in high setting. For bandstacked LNBs this is the horizontal/left polarization band.
lnb.loflow_desc: This defines the offset the frequency coming from the LNB will be in low setting. For bandstacked LNBs this is the vertical/right polarization band.
lnb.lofswitch_desc: This defines at what frequency the LNB will do a switch from high to low setting, and vice versa.
lnb.preset_desc: Select the LNB preset from the list, or choose 'Custom' and set the advanced settings below.
lnb.reversed_desc: This defines whether the signal reaching the LNB is reversed from normal polarization. This happens to circular signals bouncing twice on a toroidal dish.
lnb.title: Satellite Receiver (LNB)
lnb.type_desc: Select the type of LNB from the list.

rotor.hispeed_desc: To allow the approximate monitoring of rotor movement, enter the rated angular speed of the rotor when powered at 18V.
rotor.latitude_desc: The Cartesian latitude for your location. Use negative numbers for southern coordinates.
rotor.longitude_desc: The Cartesian longitude for your location. Use negative numbers for western coordinates.
rotor.lospeed_desc: To allow the approximate monitoring of rotor movement, enter the rated angular speed of the rotor when powered at 13V.
rotor.positions_desc: Rotor position setup. Negative values indicate West, positive values indicate East.
rotor.title: Rotor Configuration
rotor.type_desc: Select the type of rotor from the list.

switch.title: Switch Configuration
switch.type_desc: Select the type of switch from the list.

diseqc.switchports_desc: The number of ports this switch has.
diseqc.switchports_error: ERROR: You have too many devices for this number of ports.
diseqc.userband_desc: Unicable userband ID (0-7). The Unicable userband channels are often numbered starting at 1 but MythTV starts at 0.

dvb.devInUse: Warning: This device is already in use.
dvb.eitscan_desc: If enabled, activate active scanning for program data (EIT). When this option is enabled the DVB card is constantly in use.
dvb.eitscan_label: Use DVB card for active EIT scan
dvb.ondemand_desc: If enabled, only open the DVB card when required, leaving it free for other programs at other times.
dvb.satellite_connect_tooltip: Connect an existing satellite configuration to this tuner
dvb.satellite_delete_desc: This will delete the Satellite device and all downstream devices.
dvb.satellite_disconnect_error: Satellite setting is in use on another tuner, cannot be deleted. Use Disconnect Instead.
dvb.satellite_disconnect_warning: This will disconnect the satellite settings from this tuner. They can still be used with other tuners.
dvb.title: DVB-T/S/C, ATSC or ISDB-T tuner card
dvb.tuningdelay_desc: Some Linux DVB drivers, in particular for the Hauppauge Nova-T, require that we slow down the tuning process by specifying a delay (in milliseconds).
dvb.wait_desc: If enabled, drop packets from the start of a DVB recording until a sequence start header is seen.

external.command_desc: A black box application controlled via stdin, status on stderr and TransportStream read from stdout. Use absolute path of executable filename followed by a space and any required parameters. Please ensure the file is a valid executable residing on the backend server.
external.title: External (Black Box) Recorder

firewire.model_desc: Choose the model that most closely resembles your set top box. Depending on firmware revision SA4200HD may work better for a SA3250HD box.
firewire.title: FireWire Cable Box

capture.frontend_desc: Identification string reported by the card. If the message "Could not get card info..." appears the card can be in use by another program.

hdhomerun.device_desc: Use tuners from selected HDHomeRun devices.
hdhomerun.eitscan_label: Use HDHomeRun for active EIT scan
hdhomerun.title: HDHomeRun Networked Tuner

hdpvr.audiodevice_desc: If there is more than one audio input, select which one to use.
hdpvr.title: HD-PVR H.264 Encoder

import.file_desc: A local file used to simulate a recording. Set to '/' to use MythEvents to trigger an external program to import recording files.
import.title: Import Test Recorder

capture.inputname_desc: If your card supports more than one delivery system then you can select here the one that you want to use.

iptv.title: IPTV Recorder
iptv.url_desc: URL of M3U containing RTSP/RTP/UDP channel URLs.

satip.device_desc: Device IP or ID, tuner number and tuner type of available Sat>IP device.
satip.diseqcpos_desc: Position of the LNB on the DiSEqC switch. Leave at 1 if there is no DiSEqC switch and the LNB is directly connected to the SatIP server. This value is used as signal source (attribute src) in the SatIP tune command.
satip.friendly_desc: Friendly name of the Sat>IP server
satip.title: Sat>IP Networked Tuner

capture.sigtimeout_desc: Maximum time (in milliseconds) MythTV waits for a signal when scanning for channels.
capture.title: Capture Cards
capture.tunerindex_desc: Index of the tuner on the Sat>IP server
capture.tunetimeout_desc: Maximum time (in milliseconds) MythTV waits for a channel lock.  For recordings, if this time is exceeded, the recording will be marked as failed.

vbox.device_desc: Device IP or ID, tuner number and tuner type of available VBox devices.
vbox.ipaddress_desc: Device IP or ID of a VBox device. eg. '192.168.1.100' or 'vbox_3718'
vbox.title: V@Box TV Gateway networked tuner
vbox.tuner_desc: Number and type of the tuner to use. eg '1-DVBT/T2'.

chanedit.channum_desc: The number by which the channel is known to MythTV
chanedit.commmethod_desc: Changes the method of commercial detection used for recordings on this channel or skips detection by marking the channel as Commercial Free.
chanedit.delete_details: This will delete Channel:{{ChanNum}}, Name:{{ChannelName}}, Source:{{Source}}
chanedit.delete_message: To delete channels use Backend Setup Channel Editor.
chanedit.delete_source: Delete all Channels from Selected Source
chanedit.delete_source_details: This will delete all channels from source: {{Source}}
chanedit.eit_desc: If enabled, guide information for this channel will be updated using 'Over-the-Air' program listings.
chanedit.format_desc: If this channel uses a format other than TV Format in the General Backend Setup screen, set it here.
chanedit.freqid_desc: Channel Number as understood by your tuners.
chanedit.priority_desc: "Number of priority points to be added to any recording on this channel during scheduling. Use a positive number as the priority if you want this to be a preferred channel, a negative one to deprecate this channel.
chanedit.serviceid_desc: Service ID (Program Number) of desired channel within the transport stream. If there is only one channel, then setting this to anything will still find it.
chanedit.source_desc: It is NOT a good idea to change this value as it only changes the sourceid in table channel but not in dtv_multiplex. The sourceid in dtv_multiplex cannot and should not be changed.
chanedit.timeoffset_desc: Offset (in minutes) to apply to the program guide data during import.  This can be used when the listings for a particular channel are in a different time zone.
chanedit.title: Channel Editor
chanedit.visible_desc: If set to Always Visible or Visible, the channel will be visible in the EPG.  Set to Always Visible or Never Visible to prevent MythTV and other utilities from automatically managing the value for this channel..
chanedit.xmltvid_desc: ID used by listing services to get an exact correspondence between a channel in your line-up and a channel in their database. Normally this is set automatically when 'mythfilldatabase' is run.

channelscan.addfullts_desc: If set, create MPTS channels, which allow recording of the full, unaltered, transport stream.
channelscan.atscmodulation_desc: Modulation, 8-VSB, QAM-256, etc. Most cable systems in the United States use QAM-256 or QAM-64, but some mixed systems may use 8-VSB for over-the-air channels.
channelscan.chancount_desc: Total number of channels to scan
channelscan.channelnumbersonly_desc: If set, only services with a Logical Channel Number will be added during the scan. This will filter out services for set-top-box firmware download and video-on-demand that can be present on DVB-C networks.
channelscan.completeonly_desc: If set, only services that are present in the PAT, the PMT and the SDT and that have a name will be added during the scan. On satellites there are many incomplete channels, such as feeds and offline channels, that are not useful in a MythTV system. These are filtered out by this option.
channelscan.dvbcsymbolrate_desc: Most DVB-C transports transmit at 6900000 or 6875000 symbols per second.
channelscan.dvbsmodulation_desc: Modulation, QPSK, 8PSK, QAM-16, 16APSK, 32APSK. Most DVB-S transponders use QPSK, while DVB-S2 use 8PSK, 16APSK, or 32APSK. QAM-16 is not available for DVB-S2 transports.
channelscan.dvbssymbolrate_desc: Most DVB-S transponders transmit at 27500000 symbols per second.
channelscan.follownitsetting_desc: Digital transmissions may signal other available Transports. If this option is enabled the scanner scans all signaled transports for new/updated channels.
channelscan.freqtable_desc: The option of scanning only "High" frequency channels is useful because most digital channels are on the higher frequencies.
channelscan.frequency_desc: The frequency for this transport (multiplex) in {{unit}}. The default is set in Video Source Setup.
channelscan.ftaonly_desc: If set, only non-encrypted channels will be added during the scan.
channelscan.fullsearch_desc: If set, compare all channels in the database with the channels found in the scan; otherwise only the channels in the same transport are compared. This option is useful when you want to keep channel data such as the xmltvid and the icon path when doing a rescan after channels have been rearranged across transports.
channelscan.ignoresignaltimeout_desc: This option allows you to slow down the scan for broken drivers, such as the DVB drivers for the Leadtek LR6650 DVB card.
channelscan.inversion_desc: Most cards can autodetect this now, so leave it at Auto unless it won't work. (Default: Auto)
channelscan.removeduplicates_desc: If set, select the transport stream multiplex with the best signal when identical transports are received on different frequencies. This option is useful for DVB-T2 and ATSC/OTA when a transport can sometimes be received from different transmitters.
channelscan.sattuning_desc: Select a satellite from this list for the tuning data of the reference transponder.
channelscan.scan_desc: Before running this you must select the video source, and save the page if any changes have not been saved.
channelscan.scantype_dvbt_desc: For DVB-T/T2 and scan type 'Full Scan' select a country to get the correct set of frequencies.
channelscan.services_desc: TV - Adds A/V services only, TV+Radio - Adds all services with audio, All - Adds all services including data only services).
channelscan.testdecryptable_desc: Test all channels to see if they can be decrypted with installed CAM/smartcard. Sometimes the encrypted flag is set spuriously. Attention: Enabling this option increases the scan time for each encrypted channel by a couple of seconds.

common.warning: If you continue you may lose your changes.

eit.crawl_desc: The minimum number of seconds after a recorder becomes idle to wait before MythTV begins collecting EIT listings data.
eit.subtitle: If you are using listings transmitted by the station, these options define how MythTV searches for them.
eit.timeout_desc: Maximum time to spend waiting (in minutes) for listings data on one digital TV channel before checking for new listings data on the next channel.
eit.title: EIT Scanner Options

epgdownload.enabled_desc: If enabled, the guide data program will be run automatically.
epgdownload.title: Program Schedule Downloading Options

hostaddress.allowconn_desc: Allow this backend to receive connections from any IP address on the internet. NOT recommended for most users. Use this only if you have secure IPv4 and IPv6 firewalls.
hostaddress.backendport_desc: The port the backend listens on for connections (Unless you have a good reason don't change this). Default is 6543
hostaddress.ipv4_desc: Enter the IP address of this machine. Use an externally accessible address (ie, not 127.0.0.1) if you are going to be running a frontend on a different machine that this one. Note, in IPv6 setups, this is still required for certain extra such as UPnP.
hostaddress.ipv6_desc: Enter the IPv6 address of this machine. Use an externally accessible address (ie, not ::1) if you are going to be running a frontend on a different machine that this one.
hostaddress.ismaster_desc: Enable this if this is the only backend or is the master backend server. If enabled, all frontend and non-master backend machines will connect to this server. To change to a new master backend, run setup on that server and select it as master backend.
hostaddress.ismaster_hint: To change Master Backend you have to run setup from that backend.
hostaddress.ismaster_label: This server is the Master Backend
hostaddress.listenall_desc: Allow this backend to receive connections on any IP Address assigned to it. Recommended for most users for ease and reliability.
hostaddress.listenlinklocal_desc: Enable servers on this machine to listen on link-local addresses. These are auto-configured addresses and not accessible outside the local network. This must be enabled for anything requiring Bonjour to work.
hostaddress.master_desc: Host name of the Master Backend. Read only Setting This is set by selecting "This server is the Master Backend" on that server.
hostaddress.pin_desc: The PIN code required for a frontend to connect to the backend. Blank prevents all connections; 0000 allows any client. Default is 0000
hostaddress.primaryip_desc: The primary IP address of this backend server. You can select an IP address from the list or type a DNS name or host name. Other systems will contact this server using this address. If you use a hostname make sure it is assigned an IP address other than 127.0.0.1 in the hosts file.
hostaddress.statusport_desc: The port on which the server will listen on for HTTP requests, including backend status and MythXML requests. Default is 6544
hostaddress.subtitle: These settings tell the backend which IP addresse(s) and ports to listen on and whether it is a master backend.
hostaddress.title: Host Address Backend Setup

iconnection.delivery_desc: For DVB devices this shows the delivery system (modulation), for instance DVB-T2, that you have selected when you configured the capture card. This must be the same as the modulation used by the video source.
iconnection.dishneteit_desc: If you point your satellite dish toward DishNet's birds, you may wish to enable this feature. For best results, enable general EIT collection as well.
iconnection.displayname_desc: This name is displayed on screen when Live TV begins and in various other places.  Make sure the last two characters are unique for each input or use a slash ('/') to designate the unique portion.
iconnection.externalcmd_desc: If specified, this command will be run to change the channel for inputs which have an external tuner device such as a cable box. The first argument will be the channel number.

fetch.desc: This uses the listings data source to provide the channels for this input. This can take a long time to run. Before running this you must select the video source, and save the page if any changes have not been saved.
fetch.incompatible: This device is incompatible with channel fetching
fetch.label: Fetch Channels from Listings Source
fetch.warning: Only fetch channels from the listing service if you cannot scan for channels.

iconnection.inpgroup_desc: Input groups are only needed when two or more cards share the same resource such as a FireWire card and an analog card input controlling the same set top box. Leave blank unless this input is shared with another device. Only one of the inputs in an input group will be allowed to record at any given time.
iconnection.liveorder_desc: When entering Live TV, the available, local input with the lowest, non-zero value will be used. If no local inputs are available, the available, remote input with the lowest, non-zero value will be used. Setting this value to zero will make the input unavailable to live TV.
iconnection.longitude_desc: Locates the satellite you wish to point to with the longitude along the Clarke Belt of the satellite [-180..180] and its hemisphere.
iconnection.maxrec_desc: Maximum number of simultaneous recordings MythTV will attempt using this device. If set to a value other than 1, MythTV can sometimes record multiple programs on the same multiplex or overlapping copies of the same program on a single channel.
iconnection.quicktune_desc: If enabled, MythTV will tune using only the MPEG program number. The program numbers change more often than DVB or ATSC tuning parameters, so this is slightly less reliable. This will also inhibit EIT gathering during Live TV and recording.
iconnection.recpri_desc: If the input priority is not equal for all inputs, the scheduler may choose to record a show at a later time so that it can record on an input with a higher value.
iconnection.schedgrp_desc: Schedule all virtual inputs on this device as a group. This is more efficient than scheduling each input individually. Additionally, virtual nputs will be automatically added as needed to fulfill the recording load.
iconnection.schedorder_desc: If priorities and other factors are equal the scheduler will choose the available input with the lowest, non-zero value. Setting this value to zero will make the input unavailable to the scheduler.
iconnection.sourceid_desc: Select the listings source that will be used with this input.
iconnection.startchan_desc: This channel is shown when 'Watch TV' is selected on the main menu. It is updated on every Live TV channel change. When the value is not valid a suitable default will be chosen.
iconnection.switchport_desc: Choose a port to use for this switch.
iconnection.title: Input Connection
iconnection.tunechan_desc: Leave this blank unless you have an external tuner that is connected to the tuner input of your card. If so, you will need to specify the preset channel for the signal (normally 3 or 4).

jobqbackend.allow_desc: If enabled, allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.
jobqbackend.cpu_desc: This setting controls approximately how much CPU jobs in the queue may consume. On 'High', all available CPU time may be used, which could cause problems on slower systems.
jobqbackend.end_desc: This setting controls the end of the Job Queue time window, which determines when new jobs will be started.
jobqbackend.freq_desc: When looking for new jobs to process, the Job Queue will wait this many seconds between checks.
jobqbackend.maxjobs_desc: The Job Queue will be limited to running this many simultaneous jobs on this backend.
jobqbackend.maxjobs_label: Maximum Simultaneous Jobs on this Backend
jobqbackend.start_desc: This setting controls the start of the Job Queue time window, which determines when new jobs will be started.
jobqbackend.subtitle: Job Queue Controls Specific to This Backend
jobqbackend.title: Job Queue (Backend-Specific)

jobqcommands.command_desc: The command to run whenever this User Job number is scheduled.
jobqcommands.job_desc: The description for this User Job.
jobqcommands.subtitle: Set up Names for your custom user jobs and commands that will execute them.
jobqcommands.title: Job Queue (Job Commands)

jobqglobal.commcmd_desc: The program used to detect commercials in a recording. The default is 'mythcommflag' if this setting is empty.
jobqglobal.runonrechost_desc: If enabled, jobs in the queue will be required to run on the backend that made the original recording.
jobqglobal.runonrechost_label: Run Jobs Only on Original Recording Backend
jobqglobal.startcomm_desc: If enabled, and Auto Commercial Detection is ON for a recording, the flagging job will be started as soon as the recording starts. NOT recommended on underpowered systems.
jobqglobal.startcomm_label: Start Auto Commercial Detection Jobs when the Recording Starts
jobqglobal.title: Job Queue (Global)
jobqglobal.transcmd_desc: The program used to transcode recordings. The default is 'mythtranscode' if this setting is empty.
jobqglobal.transfirst_desc: If enabled, and if both auto-transcode and commercial detection are turned ON for a recording, transcoding will run first; otherwise, commercial detection runs first.
jobqglobal.transfirst_label: Run Transcode Jobs Before Auto Commercial Detection
jobqglobal.transsave_desc: If enabled and the transcoder is active, the original files will be renamed to .old once the transcoding is complete.

locale.channfreq_desc: Select the appropriate frequency table for your system. If you have an aerial, use a '-bcast frequency.
locale.subtitle: These set some country specific default settings
locale.title: Locale Settings
locale.tvformat_desc: The TV standard to use for viewing TV.
locale.vbiformat_desc: The VBI (Vertical Blanking Interval) is used to carry Teletext or Closed Captions data.

main.enableupdates_desc: Enabling updates will prevent any recordings from taking place until you restart
main.restart_desc: Recordings are disabled until you restart
main.slave_enabled: Updates are always enabled on a slave backend.
main.slave_instructions: This appears to be a slave backend. If it is intended as a slave backend, please disable scheduling on the master backend while running slave backend setup.
main.slave_warning: If this is not intended as a slave backend, please go to Setup, General, Host Address Backend Setup, and select "This server is the Master Backend" or else set the correct custom identifier on the Database Setup page. Save and Restart the backend,
main.title: MythTV Setup

misc.disback_desc: If enabled, MythTV will not backup the database before upgrades. You should therefore have your own database backup strategy in place.
misc.disfwr_desc: By default, MythTV resets the FireWire bus when a FireWire recorder stops responding to commands. If this causes problems, you can disable this behavior here.
misc.follow_desc: If enabled, MythTV will follow symlinks when recordings and related files are deleted, instead of deleting the symlink and leaving the actual file.
misc.follow_label: Follow Symbolic Links When Deleting Files
misc.mbo_desc: If enabled, the master backend will stream and delete files if it finds them in a storage directory. Useful if you are using a central storage location, like a NFS share, and your slave backend isn't running.
misc.ringbuf_desc: The HD device ringbuffer allows the backend to weather moments of stress. The larger the ringbuffer (in kilobytes), the longer the moments of stress can be. However, setting the size too large can cause swapping, which is detrimental.
misc.sg_desc: This setting controls how the Storage Group scheduling code will balance new recordings across directories. 'Balanced Free Space' is the recommended method for most users.
misc.slowly_desc: Some filesystems use a lot of resources when deleting large files. If enabled, this option makes MythTV delete files slowly on this backend to lessen the impact.
misc.statapp_desc: External application or script that outputs extra information for inclusion in the backend status page. See Miscellaneous Status Information in the wiki.
misc.subtitle: General Backend Settings
misc.title: Miscellaneous Settings
misc.upnp_desc: Which tree to show a Windows Media Player client when it requests a list of videos.
misc.upnp_label: Video content to show a WMP client

rprofiles.autotranscode_desc: Automatically transcode when a recording is made using this profile and the recording's schedule is configured to allow transcoding.
rprofiles.delete_details: This will delete Profile {{ProfileName}} in group {{GroupName}}.
rprofiles.encodingthreadcount_desc: Set to a value less than or equal to the number of processors on the backend that will be doing the encoding.
rprofiles.height_desc: Height to use for encoding. Note: PVR-x50 cards may produce ghosting if this is not set to 480 or 576 for NTSC and PAL, respectively.
rprofiles.mp3quality_desc: The higher the slider number, the lower the quality of the audio. Better quality audio (lower numbers) requires more CPU.
rprofiles.mpeg2aspectratio_desc: Sets the aspect ratio of stream generated by your PVR.
rprofiles.mpeg2bitrate_desc: Average bitrate in kilobits/second. As a guide, 2200 kb/s is approximately 1 GB/hour.
rprofiles.mpeg2language_desc: Chooses the language(s) to record when two languages are broadcast. Only Layer II supports the recording of two languages (Dual). Requires ivtv 0.4.0 or later.
rprofiles.mpeg2maxbitrate_desc: Maximum bitrate in kilobits/second. As a guide, 2200 kb/s is approximately 1 GB/hour.
rprofiles.mpeg2streamtype_desc: Sets the type of stream generated by your PVR.
rprofiles.mpeg4bitrate_desc: Bitrate in kilobits/second. As a guide, 2200 kb/s is approximately 1 GB/hr.
rprofiles.mpeg4option4mv_desc: If set, the MPEG4 encoder will use '4MV' motion-vector encoding.  This requires much more processing, but can result in better video. It is highly recommended that the HQ option is enabled if 4MV is enabled.
rprofiles.mpeg4optionidct_desc: If set, the MPEG4 encoder will use interlaced DCT encoding. You may want this when encoding interlaced video; however, this is experimental and may cause damaged video.
rprofiles.mpeg4optionime_desc: If set, the MPEG4 encoder will use interlaced motion estimation. You may want this when encoding interlaced video; however, this is experimental and may cause damaged video.
rprofiles.mpeg4optionvhq_desc: If set, the MPEG4 encoder will use 'high-quality' encoding options. This requires much more processing, but can result in better video.
rprofiles.mpeg4quality_desc: Modifying the default may have severe consequences.
rprofiles.recordingtype_desc: This option allows you to filter out unwanted streams. 'Normal' will record all relevant streams including interactive television data. 'TV Only' will record only audio, video and subtitle streams.
rprofiles.recordmpts_desc: If set, extra files will be created for each recording with the name of the recording followed by '.ts.raw'. These extra files represent the full contents of the transport stream used to generate the recording. (For debugging purposes)
rprofiles.samplerate_desc: Sets the audio sampling rate for your DSP. Ensure that you choose a sampling rate appropriate for your device.  btaudio may only allow 32000.
rprofiles.scalebitrate_desc: If set, the bitrate specified will be used for 640x480. If other resolutions are used, the bitrate will be scaled appropriately.
rprofiles.title: Recording Profiles
rprofiles.volume_desc: Recording volume of the capture card.
rprofiles.width_desc: Width to use for encoding. Note: PVR-x50 cards may produce ghosting if this is not set to 720 or 768 for NTSC and PAL, respectively.

shutwake.block_desc: If enabled, the automatic shutdown routine will be disabled until a client connects.
shutwake.idletime_desc: The number of seconds the master backend idles before it shuts down all other backends. Set to 0 to disable automatic shutdown.
shutwake.maxwait_desc: The number of minutes the master backend waits for a recording. If the backend is idle but a recording starts within this time period, it won't shut down.
shutwake.preshut_desc: A command executed before the backend would shutdown. The return value determines if the backend can shutdown. 0 - yes, 1 - restart idling, 2 - reset the backend to wait for a frontend.
shutwake.serverhalt_desc: The command used to halt the backends.
shutwake.startbefore_desc: The number of seconds the master backend will be woken up before a recording starts.
shutwake.startcmd_desc: This command is executed right after starting the BE. As a parameter '$status' is replaced by either 'auto' if the machine was started automatically or 'user' if a user switched it on.
shutwake.subtitle: If you want to allow MythTV to shut down the backend when it is idle, these settings define parameters to enable that.
shutwake.timecmd_desc: The command used to set the wakeup time (passed as $time) for the Master Backend
shutwake.timeformat_desc: The format of the time string passed to the Command to set wakeup time as $time. See QT::QDateTime.toString() for details. Set to time_t for seconds since epoch.
shutwake.title: Shutdown/Wakeup Options

vsource.WOLReconnect_desc: The time in seconds to wait for the server to wake up.
vsource.WOLRetry_desc: The number of retries to wake the server before the frontend gives up.
vsource.bouquet_desc: Bouquet ID for Freesat or Sky on satellite Astra-2 28.2E. Leave this at 0 if you do not receive this satellite. This is needed to get the Freesat and Sky channel numbers. Value 272 selects Freesat bouquet 'England HD'. See the MythTV Wiki https://www.mythtv.org/wiki/DVB_UK.
vsource.eit_desc: If enabled, program guide data for channels on this source will be updated with data provided by the channels themselves 'Over-the-Air'.
vsource.freqtable_desc: Use default unless this source uses a different frequency table than the system wide table defined in the General settings.
vsource.grabber_desc: Select the listings source. Some sources require you to have a subscription.
vsource.grabberconfig_desc: Configure the grabber by running this command using ssh or terminal logged into the backend. See XMLTV in the wiki.
vsource.lcnoffset_desc: The offset is added to each logical channel number found during a scan of a DVB video source. This makes it possible to give different video sources a non-overlapping range of channel numbers. Leave at 0 if you have only one video source or if the video sources do not have DVB logical channel numbers.
vsource.nameInUse: ERROR: This name is already in use.
vsource.netid_desc: If your provider has asked you to configure a specific network identifier (Network_ID), enter it here. Leave it at -1 otherwise.
vsource.region_desc: Region ID for Freesat or Sky on satellite Astra-2 28.2E. Leave this at 0 you do not receive this satellite. This is needed to get the Freesat and Sky channel numbers. Value 1 selects region London. See the MythTV Wiki https://www.mythtv.org/wiki/DVB_UK.
vsource.scanfreq_desc: The frequency to start scanning this video source. This is then default for 'Full Scan (Tuned)' channel scanning. Frequency value in Hz for DVB-T/T2/C, in kHz for DVB-S/S2. Leave at 0 if not known.
vsource.source_desc: This name is used for the xmltv configuration file. This is a required field.
vsource.title: Video Sources

setupwizard.IPorAddressRequired: IP Address or Hostname is required
setupwizard.LocalEnabled_desc: If this frontend's host name changes often, check this box and provide a network-unique name to identify it. If unchecked, the frontend machine's local host name will be used to save preferences in the database.
setupwizard.LocalEnabled_label: Use custom identifier for frontend preferences
setupwizard.LocalHostName_desc: An identifier to use while saving the settings for this backend or frontend on the same machine.
setupwizard.WOLCommand_desc: The command executed on this machine or server MAC to wake up the database server (eg. sudo /etc/init.d/mysql restart or 32:D2:86:00:17:A8).
setupwizard.WOLEnabled_desc: If enabled, the frontend will use database wakeup parameters to reconnect to the database server.
setupwizard.dbname_help: The name of the database. This is usually 'mythconverg'.
setupwizard.ignoremessages: Ignore messages that say "Unable to load 'xxxxx' as time zone. Skipping it."
setupwizard.ipaddress_help: The hostname or IP address of the machine hosting the database.
setupwizard.password_help: The MySQL password to use while connecting to the database.
setupwizard.portRequired: Port is required and must be a number between 0 and 65536
setupwizard.port_help: The port number the database is running on. This is usually the default 3306.
setupwizard.restartbe: Restart the backend using the button at the top of this page.
setupwizard.runcommand: Then run this command on the backend:
setupwizard.sqlinstructions: If this is a new MythTV setup, create your mysql user id and database. Save the below commands to a file called setup.sql on the backend:
setupwizard.tztables: If not already done, create timezone tables by running this on the backend:
setupwizard.user_help: The MySQL user name to use while connecting to the database. The default is mythtv.

testbed.title: This is a testbed area
testbed.welcome: Welcome to MythTV Backend running on host
